title: WebpackError when building service from docker-compose
body:
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

How to reproduce the problem
---------
<!-- Include the details of how the problem occurred. Which option did you choose to install doccano? Did you come across an error? What else did you try? -->

I have cloned the repo from master (commit 59b8564) and after building the service using _docker-compose up_ and trying to acces the web page on localhost:8000, it threw this error.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41756629/67488209-ca605d00-f645-11e9-9de8-a007967c82be.png)

I have little understanding on Node.js and Django but I believe that this dependency was forgotten somewhere on the requirements. Yesterday I had made the same installation procedure and it worked fine, so it might be a problem that rose after the last PR.

```bash
WebpackError at /

            ModuleNotFoundError in 
            Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'buefy' in '/src/app/server/static/pages'
            
```

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Ubuntu 18.04
*   Python Version Used: python 3.6.8
*   When you install doccano: Thursday 24 2019
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): Pull the repo and docker-compose up
